b8810a57-2c5a-4bbc-81f1-9bfc649ad13d.description: This credential earner demonstrates a foundational understanding of cybersecurity concepts, objectives, and practices. This includes cyber threat groups, types of attacks, social engineering, case studies, overall security strategies, cryptography, and common approaches that organizations take to prevent, detect, and respond to cyber attacks. This also includes an awareness of the job market. Earners can use this knowledge to pursue further education for a variety of roles in cybersecurity.
b8810a57-2c5a-4bbc-81f1-9bfc649ad13d.name: Cybersecurity Fundamentals

badge_template_activities.title: Complete Cybersecurity Fundamentals, designed by IBM.
Pass the end-of-course assessment with a score of 80% or higher.

High school students and educators can complete the credential here.

dafd91d2-b4fa-46e2-a1fe-c9b0428d6ea7.description: This credential earner understands key skills for professional success and core soft skills needed in the information technology workforce. This includes creating and delivering presentations; using agile approaches for working professionally to deliver quality work and experiences to customers; collaborating effectively with teams; communicating with impact; dealing with challenges in a controlled and focused manner; and solving problems and implementing solutions.
dafd91d2-b4fa-46e2-a1fe-c9b0428d6ea7.name: Working in a Digital World: Professional Skills

dabbc05f-9024-4c51-a2c0-5ccd08645415.description: This credential earner understands mindfulness concepts and techniques, and has learned how to apply mindfulness practices for various situations. ce897036-6f39-4466-863f-0aa873f82213.description: This credential earner has an understanding of six emerging technologies that power today's jobs: AI, blockchain, cloud computing, cybersecurity, data and analytics, and the Internet of Things. The earner can use this knowledge to explore careers in tech.

c2128d8f-d89e-46a0-83f2-05c69fb1d187.description: This credential earner has the key knowledge, skills, and values necessary to understand and work with artificial intelligence (AI), and is aware of the implications of AI for the future of work and society in general. The earner has also practiced interviewing professionally.

c13d232e-e469-4150-8936-fda2d0b3273e.description: This credential earner has foundational knowledge in hybrid cloud computing, artificial intelligence (AI) ethics, and open source technologies. This earner know the differences between private and public clouds, the attributes of hybrid cloud, the role of data containers; the types of human ethical behavior, how they relate to AI ethics, how AI ethics can fail, and ways to reduce the resulting harm; open source history, roles, responsibilities; and the role of these technologies in jobs.
c13d232e-e469-4150-8936-fda2d0b3273e.name: Open Source Origin Stories: Adventures in Hybrid Cloud, AI Ethics, and Open Source Technologies

The earner is equipped to share the foundational knowledge of artificial intelligence with their colleagues and students in their classrooms.

e3fe4f8b-6d76-471e-8803-29aeabbc1a10.description: This credential earner has engaged in online ocean science education created by OrcaNation. The individual has an awareness of the important role that oceans play in the global environment. The earner is able to describe how human interactions affect the health of the world’s oceans, marine animals, coral reefs, and mangroves; they have foundational knowledge of marine, orca, and shark biology and ecology; and they can articulate the threats of microplastics and ghost gear to ocean environments.

4196f1eb-4ce2-4032-a0cb-3f728fb9da0d.description: This credential earner demonstrates a foundational understanding of project management concepts and processes. 0da38f98-1644-47e6-b2df-8bbdbc670237.description: This credential earner is recognized by the P-TECH Career Mentoring Program for developing and cultivating a mentoring relationship with a P-TECH mentee (student). The individual has taken relevant training to ensure quality feedback and guidance is provided to students. Mentoring is an important career development opportunity, which any individual can use to enhance skills and achieve long-term career aspirations.
0da38f98-1644-47e6-b2df-8bbdbc670237.name: P-TECH Mentor

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Be a P-TECH Mentor online course, including passing the final assessment with a score of 80% or higher.

Mentor (virtually or face-to-face) a P-TECH student through the P-TECH Career Mentoring Program, making adult-to-student connections and working to develop areas of interest of the student, including career readiness, workplace learning skills, and socialization.
Complete a badge application form. The P-TECH Career Mentoring Program coordinator will review and validate your application. Allow up to 10 business days for processing.

This badge is available for adult mentors in the P-TECH network, or any adult wishing to become a mentor in the P-TECH network; learners must be enrolled on IBM SkillsBuild for Students to access the education.
This badge is not for P-TECH students or minors.

Revalidation: This badge is valid for two years. After this period, you will need to apply to revalidate your badge. To do this, you must have mentored a P-TECH student through the P-TECH Career Mentoring Program in the past two years.

e0cf323a-01d2-48f5-a056-4c58568e0e49.description: This credential earner understands how to translate their skills into valid qualifications in the modern labor market. 49265d09-514f-4b13-9e08-cf1076e3b017.description: This credential earner is an IBMer who demonstrates specific leadership skills in support of IBM talent and business priorities, and promotes IBM educational initiatives on the IBM SkillsBuild for Students platform through volunteering and advocacy. Pass the assessment with a score of 80% or higher.

This badge is available to registered IBM users of IBM SkillsBuild.

ea3752ea-4587-4a98-a62c-e9759072881a.description: This credential earner understands what AI is and how delivering AI education prepares students for work in the 21st century.
